revised_title: Innervation and Reflex Movements of Antagonistic Muscles in Spinal Animals
tldr: This article explores the relationship between muscle innervation, posture, and reflex movements in spinal animals. Sherrington observes that the direction of reflex movements can be influenced by the initial posture of the limb, suggesting that the spinal condition and reaction are affected by the posture already present in the limb at the time of stimulus application.
